intro: Gamochaeta nivalis, commonly known as the snow gentian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and produces striking blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are typically silver or gray-green, covered in fine hairs that help reduce water loss in cold, arid conditions. Gamochaeta nivalis is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ecological importance in alpine ecosystems.
